IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: PROVIDE RESIDENTIAL CARE, NURSING HOME SERVICES, AND INDEPENDENT LIVING RENTAL UNITS FOR THE ELDERLY.
IRS990.MissionDesc: BETHESDA SEEKS TO BE A COMMUNITY FORMED BY THE SPIRIT OF JESUS CHRIST TO FULFILL THE LIVES OF ADULTS WITH SPECIAL NEEDS IN A PLACE THAT IS HOME. SEE SCHEDULE O FOR CONTINUATION.
IRS990.Desc: MENNONITE BETHESDA SOCIETY, INC. OPERATED A 45-BED MEDICAID CERTIFIED NURSING FACILITY, A 10-BED ASSISTED LIVING UNIT AND 29 INDEPENDENT LIVING UNITS IN GOESSEL, KANSAS. THE ENTITY RECORDED 10,610 RESIDENT DAYS DURING THE CURRENT FISCAL YEAR.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FOUNDATION'S PERMANENTLY RESTRICTED NET ASSETS ARE HELD AS A RESERVE FOR THE BENEFIT OF MENNONITE BETHESDA SOCIETY, INC.

MANAGEMENT HAS EVALUATED THEIR INCOME TAX POSITIONS UNDER THE GUIDANCE INCLUDED IN ASC 740. BASED ON THEIR REVIEW, MANAGEMENT HAS NOT IDENTIFIED ANY MATERIAL UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS TO BE RECORDED OR DISCLOSED IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.

RELATED ORGANIZATION REVENUE 89,245 RELATED ORGANIZATION UNREALIZED GAIN (240,325) NET ASSETS RELEASED FROM RESTRICTIONS (17,237) --------- (168,317) SCHEDULE D, PART XI, LINE 4B CONTRIBUTION FROM RELATED ORGANIZATION 67,801 BAD DEBT EXPENSE 9,531 -------- 77,332
RELATED ORGANIZATION EXPENSES 3,740 SCHEDULE D, PART XII, LINE 4B BAD DEBT EXPENSE 9,531

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE L, PART IV, LINE 1, COLUMN B

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: BETHESDA WILL BE A REGENERATIVE COMMUNITY FOR ALL RESIDENTS, STAFF, BOARD, AND FAMILIES. BETHESDA WILL ACHIEVE ITS MISSION BY HONORING THESE CORE VALUES: 1) TREASURE EVERY PERSON 2) PRACTICE DAILY WELCOME AND HOSPITALITY 3) LISTEN WITH THE HEART, HOLD CONFIDENCES, FORGIVE 4) NAME LOSSES AND CELEBRATE JOYS 5) FOSTER CHOICE, CREATIVITY, AND PLAYFULNESS 6) DEVELOP SERVANT LEADERS WHO SEEK SUPERVISION AND FOSTER EXCELLENCE 7) STATE GOALS, ACCEPT RISKS, BE ACCOUNTABLE 8) CHANGE UNJUST PRACTICES AND NEGOTIATE CONFLICTS 9) ENLARGE, DEVELOP, AND COMPLETE LIFE, RECEIVING AND GIVING BLESSINGS

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: MEMBERS OF MENNONITE BETHESDA SOCIETY, INC. MUST HAVE AN INTEREST IN THE ADVANCEMENT OF THE PURPOSES AND THE BASIC POLICIES OF THE CORPORATION. NO PERSON SHALL BE ADMITTED AS A MEMBER UNLESS SUCH PERSON SIGNS THE OFFICIAL ROSTER AT THE ANNUAL MEETING OR HAS MADE A RECORDED CONTRIBUTION TO A FUND OF THE CORPORATION DURING THE FISCAL YEAR IMMEDIATELY PRECEDING THE CURRENT ANNUAL MEETING OR IS A MEMBER OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A NOMINATING COMMITTEE, COMPOSED OF THREE MEMBERS OF THE CORPORATION SELECTED BY THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES, SHALL NOMINATE ONE OR MORE ELIGIBLE PERSONS FOR EACH VACANCY ON THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES. THE PROSPECTIVE BOARD MEMBERS WILL BE SUBMITTED TO A BALLOT OF THE MEMBERS OF THE CORPORATION FOR APPROVAL. NOMINEES SHALL BECOME BOARD MEMBERS IF APPROVED BY 51% OF THE MEMBERS VOTING AT THE ANNUAL MEETING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTING FIRM PREPARES THE FORM 990. THE ORGANIZATION'S OFFICERS THEN REVIEW THE COMPLETE FORM 990 AND ALL REQUIRED SCHEDULES. ANY QUESTIONS OR CONCERNS ARE ADDRESSED AND ANY NECESSARY CHANGES ARE MADE. THE FINAL FORM 990, WITH ALL REQUIRED SCHEDULES, IS PROVIDED TO ALL VOTING MEMBERS OF THE BOARD PRIOR TO FILING THE 990.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY APPLIES TO ALL DIRECTORS AND OFFICERS OF THE ORGANIZATION, AND IS REVIEWED AND SIGNED ANNUALLY BY ALL PARTIES COVERED BY THE POLICY. ANY POTENTIAL CONFLICTS ARE REQUIRED TO BE DISCLOSED TO THE BOARD IMMEDIATELY. THE BOARD THEN DECIDES WHETHER OR NOT A CONFLICT EXISTS. COMPLIANCE ACTIVITY FOR VOTING MEMBERS OF THE BOARD INCLUDES ABSTAINING FROM A VOTE IF A CONFLICT IS PRESENT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE MENNONITE BETHESDA BOARD OF TRUSTEES CONDUCTED A REVIEW IN 2019 ALONG WITH USING SALARY SURVEYS FROM KAHSA AND MHS. THE BOARD DOCUMENTS ITS DELIBERATIONS AND DECISIONS IN THE MINUTES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CEO CONDUCTED AN ANNUAL REVIEW IN 2021 ALONG WITH USING COMPARABLE DATA FROM SIMILAR ORGANIZATIONS IN OUR REGION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.
